thread.title: No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten
thread.title_full: No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten

title: No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten
text:
No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten The Cougars (7-0, 4-0 AAC) scored 24 points in a mid-game span of 3 1/2 minutes Post to Facebook No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten The Cougars (7-0, 4-0 AAC) scored 24 points in a mid-game span of 3 1/2 minutes Check out this story on KHOU.com: http://on.khou.com/1S31m6U Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs No. 21 Houston rolls to 59-10 win over UCF, remains unbeaten Associated Press 2:44 p.m. CDT October 24, 2015 The Cougars (7-0, 4-0 AAC) scored 24 points in a mid-game span of 3 1/2 minutes Oct 24, 2015; Orlando, FL, USA; Houston Cougars defensive back William Jackson III (3) and Brandon Wilson (26) celebrate an interception against UCF Knights during the first half at Bright House Networks Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jonathan Dyer-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Jonathan Dyer, Jonathan Dyer-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) - Kenneth Farrow ran for 167 yards and three touchdowns and No. 21 Houston remained undefeated with a 59-10 victory over winless Central Florida on Saturday. 
The Cougars (7-0, 4-0 AAC) scored 24 points in a mid-game span of 3 1/2 minutes and won for the fifth time by 21 points or more. 
Houston cornerback Brandon Wilson scored on an 85-yard return of a fumble on the third play of the game, but the Cougars fell behind 10-7 before rallying late in the first half and turning the game into a rout in the third quarter. 
Farrow's 26-yard touchdown run gave Houston the lead with 2:26 left in the half, and interceptions by William Jackson III and Donald Gage set up a TD and a field goal in the final 50 seconds. 
Tristan Payton scored UCF's touchdown on a 46-yard pass from Justin Holman, but the Golden Knights (0-8, 0-4) had four turnovers and gained only 105 yards after the first quarter.
